title: What needs to improve in order to run League more smoothly?
body:
Hello, I am really bad with computers and I just got a replacement since my old one has just broken down.
I hopped into a game and it was really laggy (ping spiking to 300-1000) when my ping used to be around 30-50.

I checked the minimum requirements to run the game but all of the driver and RAM stuff was really complicated to me. Could anyone tell me what about my computer needs to be improved in order to play the game more smoothly? Here are my computer's specs:

**Processor: **AMD A8-3800 APU with Radeon(tm) HD Graphics 2.40 GHz
**RAM:** 6.00 GB
**Hard disc space:** 900GB
**Video Card:** NVIDIA GeForce 210 (4036 MB memory)
Windows 10
Not sure about latest update to .NET Framework from Microsoft
Not sure about latest version of Adobe AIR.

Please if someone could help me I just want to be able to play the game like it used to :(

replies.body:
OP describes latency problems, therefore a video card will not resolve their core issue.

Be careful when suggesting someone replace hardware in their PC, especially if it may not resolve their issue. :P

...what are you saying? Ok, there are far better video cards out there but it does not mean it' s totes garbage! I used to run LoL with far far less at medium quality. probably with the time the requirements increased but you can hardly beat an 8400 GT :P

Latency (ping) issues are usually the result of problems either inside your local network or along your ISP routing to the server (outside your network). There are numerous settings or tests that can be run to determine this, however, our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) is a consolidated list of the most common solutions. I definitely recommend starting there before we move on to more investigation.

Let me know if those steps caused any change at all.
